title: Thunderbird Release
creator: doktorg
content: Will Thunderbird Release make it any easier to migrate Thunderbird from Win10 to Linux (Ubuntu or Mint)... With 200 million PCs becoming obsolete in a few months, I would think Mozilla would have noted that many of us are going to migrate to Linux but moving Thunderbird has been a nightmare (still unsuccessful nightmare). I've followed all the directives and none seem to work... I've been using TBird since it started and have a LOT of emails I'd prefer not to lose so if I could just get my Windows profile to work on Linux it would be great... I know you're busy, but we are facing an Armageddon of sorts out here... Help! Thanks a million cheers pj

title: Message Filter Appears to be Activated by Clicking on Folder
creator: DS256
content:
I have a rule that moves email messages from backups to a 'Backup' folder. I also have another rule that moves emails address to myself to 'My Mail'.

When I start TB 128.11.1esr in the morning my 'Backup' and 'My Mail' folders show new email counts. When I click on 'My Mail' the number on it decreases and 'Backup' increases. This happens with other rules on other folders.

So, my question is this behavior caused my 'Message Filters' being triggered when I click a folder or potentially a latent refresh of the folders new email counts.

Thanks

title: Виктор
creator: uknash_dom2012
content: Добрый день. Нужна срочно Ваша помощь. К нам пришло сообщение от почтового сервера mail.ru Что нас заблокируют с 24/06/2025 числа. Мне поддержка написала, чтобы скачать с облака почту на компьютер нужно установить почтовую программу и перечислили их в качестве примера. Я установил на свой комп Thunderbird. Создал локальную папку на компе у себя. И запустил программу, чтобы прогрузились все письма с сервера. Оставил на сутки. Потом выделил в папке входящие все письма и нажал кнопку архивировать в локальную папку. Тоже самое сделал с отправленными. В итоге сейчас на сайте начали пропадать исходящие письма и входящие. Входящие резко пропали за 25 год до 20 Хотя я ничего еще не удалял. Думал прогружу почту всю с 18 года в локальную папку на комп. Скопирую ее Архив еще раз отдельно и удалю только с облака до 21 года, чтобы освободить место в облаке. Но тут происходят чудеса. Помогите пожалуйста. Как все восстановить и сделать правильно. Готов предоставить доступ через Ани деск

title: S/MIME siganture / certificate validation
creator: mn.szczesny
content:
Dear Support Team,

I'd like to understand the design of S/MIME signature / certificate validation in Thunderbird. Lets's assume the scenarion that a message with valid signature has been received but the certificate expires very soon (next couple of days).

In my opinion, the behaviour of Thunderbird might be a bit missleading. As enclosed, S/MIME information says that certificate is untrusted, which is not really accurate. The certificate was trusted when the message has been received but now expired.

I assume that Thunderbird validates certificate only against current date. But we have the message original date in the headers. Validation process could be configurable, like in popular pdf readers (which date to use for validation), or even better it could execute 2 validations in case current date validation has not been scuccessfull and S/MIME information could cover this scenario that the signature has been valid while message been created / recived but the certificate expired. It would definitely reflect real scenario in more accurate manner.

I'd appreciate if you could let me know if there is a configuration possibility which I'm not aware of. In case it is not available, can you please advise how I could submit a proposal of functionality enhancement? In case, there are rules comming from RFC standards restricting the validation of signature in a way that has been described, I'd also appreciate this feedback.

In spite of the above remarks, I think that you did a vary good job with S/MIME functionality in thunderbird. It is far more user friendly and well presented to a user than in other email clients.


Best regards, Marcin
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:139.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/139.0

title: Calendar scroll position resets to 12:00 AM when changing tabs
creator: njardim
content:
Hi,

When I switch from the Calendar tab to any other tab (Inbox, Address Book, Tasks, etc.) and then return to Calendar, the calendar always jumps back to 12:00 AM in the daily and weekly views. Previously, it would remember the correct time range I was viewing.

For example, if I’m looking at 8:00 AM–6:00 PM time period in the calendar and switch to another tab, returning to Calendar resets the view to start at 12:00 AM. I then have to scroll down every time to get back to my usual working hours.

Please restore the previous behavior where the calendar maintains its last scrolled/viewed time range.

Thanks!

title: Not getting box to enter new password to send e-mail
creator: dannychung99
content:
I changed my Google account password just today. I have used Thunderbird on PC for Gmail without issues for years. I went into Thunderbird Saved Passwords and changed the appropriate line to the new Gmail password. I restarted Thunderbird and tried to send a test e-mail. I kept getting "Login to account Google Mail failed" with a box of 3 options, Retry, Enter New Password or Cancel. When I click on either Retry or Enter New Password, it doesn't give me a chance to enter a password and goes immediately into the same "Login to account Google Mail failed" box with the 3 options. I searched and read the support and one of the option is to remove the line from Saved Passwords and re-create it. I did that and tried to send another test e-mail. Now I'm still not getting a chance to enter a new password. I keep getting the box with the 3 options which doesn't allow me to enter a new password. There isn't a new entry in the Saved Passwords.

Strange thing is Thunderbird is receiving new e-mails fine. I'm just not able to send.

Thanks.
metadata: ;solver_id:181052;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/137.0.0.0 Safari/537.36
